PM's smoke-free products now comprise 41.3% of sales, with ZYN, IQOS, and VEEV brands showing robust global momentum and market leadership. result.title: Philip Morris' Bull Trap Nearing Its End - Robust Smoke Free Prospects
result.text: PM's meltdown from recent heights has occurred as expected, with the prior rally occurring too fast, while triggering the impacted dividend investment thesis. This is especially since the previous Zyn supply tightness has triggered its deteriorating volume market share, with the company having to engage on aggressive marketing during recent brand relaunch. PM is finally reasonably valued at estimated 3Y PEG ratio of 1.77x, aided by the richer profit margins and the robust smoke free growth prospects.

result.title: Philip Morris Is Still Pricey And Could Retrace Further
result.text: Philip Morris delivered strong Q2 2024 results, driven by record revenues, robust smoke-free product growth, and expanding operating margins. Despite operational momentum, PM's current valuation appears stretched versus peers MO and BTI, making its risk/reward less attractive at current prices. Remain neutral on PM, expecting a retracement to around $147 before turning bullish again, which would offer a more compelling entry and a 4% dividend yield.

result.title: Philip Morris: Recent Sell-Off Is An Excellent Buying Opportunity
result.text: Philip Morris International (PM) remains a strong buy after a recent sell-off, with long-term growth prospects outweighing short-term concerns. PM's dominant positions in smokeless (Zyn) and heated tobacco (IQOS) markets, plus successful acquisitions, support robust earnings growth projections. Despite slower Zyn growth and regulatory headwinds, PM's innovation and market share gains in key segments reinforce its leadership and undervaluation.

result.title: How To Survive A 30% Market Crash In Retirement
result.text: Sequence of return risk can devastate retirement portfolios, especially when early negative returns coincide with withdrawals, undermining the traditional 4% rule. Dividend investing offers a powerful solution by providing steady cash flows that are largely independent of market volatility, neutralizing sequence risk. Building a portfolio of high-quality, dividend-growing stocks can deliver superior returns and reduce stress.
